intro: Hookera hirtella, commonly known as the alpine snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Hookera hirtella has hairy leaves and stems, which help protect it from harsh weather. It is often found in the Andes and is a symbol of the unique biodiversity of high-altitude ecosystems.
